intro: Corysanthes macrantha, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom during the summer months. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough, hairy texture, adding to its distinctive appearance.
